subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Profit Meets Purpose: The Double Bottom Line
description: A quick, practical guide to Profit Meets Purpose: The Double Bottom Line.

hook.text: Traditional business has one goal: profit. Traditional charity has one goal: impact. Both leave gaps.

buildup.text: Businesses ignore problems that aren't profitable. Charities collapse when donations dry up.

discovery.text: Social entrepreneurs found the sweet spot: organizations that earn revenue by solving social problems.

twist.text: This 'double bottom line' confused investors and donors alike. Neither camp fully understood it.

climax.text: Yet companies blending profit with purpose now represent one of the fastest-growing sectors globally.

punchline.text: The best enterprises make money and meaning at once.

quiz.question: What does the 'double bottom line' refer to in social entrepreneurship?
options: Measuring both financial returns and social impact together
Having two separate bank accounts for profit and donations
Doubling revenue by entering two different markets
